Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, luxurious--great price for what you get!!!”
Reviews.Author: nancyandashesh
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed for two nights at the end of July 2005. It's taken me a while to write this review, but I keep a travel journal so have lots of notes--and memories--to draw from. First, never go to Venice in July--the heat is so oppressive!!! But if you must, the Antico Doge is very well air-conditioned and was truly a refuge for us. Our room, 202, had silk tapestry wallpaper, the double bed was hung with fabric and tassles, exposed wood ceiling, burled walnut furniture, sofa, and mini-bar. Quite a spacious room! The bathroom was all marble with carved marble accents, even in the shower. Gorgeous room. The breakfast room is amazing: antique mirrors, painted ceiling, chandelier, silk walls, and you sit on gilt chairs at marble-top tables. The food was good: cereal, yogurt, pastries, rolls, cheese, ham, juices. Real china to eat off of!! Front desk staff very helpful, though not very knowledgable about close-by eateries. But they let us store our luggage downstairs after we checked out. Also, we had to climb two long flights of stairs to get to our room, so watch out for that. But the stairways are quite beautiful, so if you have to pause, there's lots to look at. We highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful break in Venice. What can I say that probably hasn't been said before! As for the hotel I trawled my way thorugh the majority of hotels on this site and took a punt on the Antico Doge. We weren't disappointed, the room was comfortable and plush, the bathroom was fantastic and the staff were a delight. The hotel is also located well for all major sites although to be fair Venice was a lot smaller than I expected. It's size however makes for a wonderful opportunity to take left and rights willy nilly and still somehow manage to come out somewhere you vaguely recognise. Go and enjoy Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Moderate Price”
Reviews.Author: washingtondcgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antico Doge in mid-November 2005, and found the accommodations reasonable for the price, and the staff extremely pleasant and helpful. We stayed in the least expensive double room, 110 euros per night for a double bed and private bath with shower. Although small, the room was well-appointed, with a desk, mini bar and small closet in addition to the bed and bathroom, which was very nicely sized for an Italian hotel. The rate also included a standard breakfast of rolls, cheese and yogurt, along with coffee and tea. The English speaking staff was very friendly, and offered to obtain tickets to local shows. (Do note that the opera tickets are for an opera "demonstration," and not an actual show.) The staff also arranged for a private water taxi, included in the price of the room, to visit Murano island. Thanks to the directions included on the Web site, the hotel was very easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice”
Reviews.Author: travel2b
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suite overlooking the canal. LOTS of pedestrian traffic did not disturb us and added to the ambiance of a bustling Venice. All the many positive reviews of this hotel are justified, particularly the positives on the location. Ideal. Two things to be aware of: (1) there is no lobby. The desk is it. (2) We were not offered assistance with our bags, the key was handed to us and we were on our own. But those are two nit-picks. Oh, any restaurant in the immediate area is a good one. Ask at the desk. For a real dining treat try Da Fiore. The only Michelin starred restaurant in Venice. Worth every euro (expect 200 per couple, including wine)

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Quaint, but beware of noise”
Reviews.Author: KarenV
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antico Doge is a charming hotel, with pleasant staff and beautiful rooms. Our stay in October 2005 was enjoyable enough, except for one minor detail. We had the suite room that had a quaint balcony overlooking a canal and square.I loved the room...I did not like the noise. I realize that most rooms in Venice have street noise, but this room was directly above the 'freeway'in Venice. What I mean is that there are two main walkways that take you from one side of the city to the other that most locals and tourists use to 'commute' (they walk). Our room was just above a seemingly endless, constant throng of people from very early to late. I loved the view of the canal,the fabric covered walls,the jelly filled croissants, but in all the reviews I read on this site no one ever mentioned the 'freeway' under the front rooms. We used ear plugs and extra pillows and did just fine. Otherwise, a great time in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic venice in quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: happytime19
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at end of May 2005. Chose this hotel from reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed! Hotel is situated a very short walk from the Vaporetta stop (c'a D'oro) with local shops nearby. The hotel itself is in an old typically venetian building with a bridge and canal outside the front door and a campinale with clock and bell opposite! We had a Superior room which was extremely well decorated with material flocked walls , canopied bed and marbled shower room all in tones of pale cream/gold. We even had a tiny ivy clad balcony overlooking a side street. Continental breakfast is served in period decorated room with cupid murals on ceiling. Concierge was very helpful with map and one of them was the tour guide for the Grand Canal boat trip in the afternoon! Would recommed this hotel highly if you are looking for excellent 3* in good location (5 min walk from Rialto Bridge)

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Antico Doge
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 5643 | Campo SS Apostoli, 30131 Venice, Italy
